current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt aircraft management services from the ticket
			 tax.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

header.#text: Exemption from ticket tax for aircraft management services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by redesignating subsection  (k) as
			 subsection (l) and by inserting after subsection (j)  the following new
			 subsection:

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall not apply to the provision of aircraft
			 management services for flights  under the aviation safety regulations of
			 part 91 of  title 14, Code of Federal Regulations.

text.#text: The tax imposed by this section or

Paragraph (1) shall not exempt flights for the transportation of persons under	the aviation safety
			 regulations of part 135 of title  14, Code of Federal Regulations.

quote.#tail:
means scheduling, flight planning, weather forecasting, and operation of flights; obtaining
			 insurance; maintenance, storage and fueling of  aircraft; hiring, training
			 and provision of pilots and  crew; establishing and complying with safety
			 standards; and such other services necessary to support  flights.

text.#text: For purposes of paragraph (1), the term

The amendment made by	this section shall apply to transportation beginning after  the date of the
			 enactment of this Act.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 S2775 IS: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exempt aircraft management services from the ticket tax.
